Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type C stemless cup; interior: black-figure decoration in tondo, part of gorgoneion with added red tongue and hair and added white tusks; exterior: fillet in red at join of wall and foot; foot glazed black save for thin reserved band at top and bottom and stand-ring; underside of bowl reserved with graffito.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unmarked, found in drawer labelled 'mainly Naukratis.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 438, no. B712)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0676) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
